TW: From 2015-2019 the average recovery for unsecured in the E&P space was about 21%. For oil field services it was 37%. Many companies during last downturn filed Ch 11 vs Ch 7. I would guess this time around, given investor sentiment, more companies will file Ch 7(liquidiation)

...and the surplus of Atlantic crudes may put more pressure on Brent in the short term #SPGlobalOnOil

Another one for @SPDJIndices Fiona Boal - How does the performance of energy sector compare to the performance of other commodity sectors? #SPGlobalOnOil

Tom Watters @SPGlobalRatings: If this price war is extended, it‚Äôs likely we experience a high number of defaults/bankruptcies in US #shale. About 80% of the upstream portfolio is high yield and during downturns like this, if extended, they don‚Äôt quite have the staying power.
#SPGlobalOnOil One for @SPGlobalRatings what are your views on the credit quality for US Shale producers in this lower price environment?

The drop of oil prices has seen the price of Saudi Aramco shares drop below the initial IPO price. This will be of concern but this is a long term strategy and the Reliance deal may still has value in providing more exposure to downstream to integrate their upstream supply length

Nigeria crude may struggle to compete with the deluge of cheap middle eastern crude into Asia forcing it to price down into Europe and other markets. With 1 million barrels a day Libyan crude out of the market this helps to provide some buying support in the Med. #SPGlobalOnOil

#SPGlobalOnOil Fiona Boal @SPDJIndices: Through the first 9 trading days of March (12 March MTD) the S&P GSCI Brent Crude Oil -31.1% + the S&P Energy Sector-35.2%. Both continue to be pummeled by the two pronged threat of slowing oil demand and a forthcoming supply spike from SA

China will most likely take advantage of low cost, shorter range Middle Eastern barrels rather than the longer range Atlantic Basin Crude barrels (West Africa, Brazil, North Sea and US Grades). - Chris Midgley #SPGlobalOnOil

And that is a wrap! Thank you to all our winners, nominees, attendees and of course, sponsors. We look forward to seeing you again next year! #PlattsGEA

#PlattsGEA: We now move onto our final award for this evening - Energy Company of the year - demonstrating all around excellence and a total energy strategy. Our 2019 winner is...@bakerhughesco! Very well done to all!
#PlattsGEA: Now onto our penultimate award this evening - the award for Chief Executive of the Year. This prestigous award goes to Vicki Hollub of @WeAreOxy. Congratulations on a well deserved win!

#PlattsGEA: Now we move on to a new category - Chief Trailblazer of the Year. This award honours gamechanging performance by the CEO of a company. This excellent achievement goes to Paula Gold-Williams from @cpsenergy

#PlattsGEA: This year‚Äôs Lifetime Achievement Award goes to a leader who has ‚Äústood the test of time‚Äù over nearly five decades, with a career-long focus on electric utilities. Congratulations to Caren Byrd from @MorganStanley - an excellent achievement and very well deserved
#PlattsGEA - Our next award recognises leadership in transition in a low carbon energy economy. Our winner for this year‚Äôs Energy Transition Award is @iberdrola!

#PlattsGEA We now move on to our next award for Grid Edge. This award recognises a distinct application for solving specific inefficiencies across a grid. Our winner for this year is... @GridBeyond_! Well done to all!

#PlattsGEA: We now come to the award for Corporate Deal of the Year. This award recognised the successful completion of opportunity in uncertain markets. And our winner is - @enelgreenpower! Very well deserved

We hope you‚Äôre enjoying this evening‚Äôs coverage of #PlattsGEA. Up next we have the award for Financial Investment of the Year. Celebrating the rigorous analysis and unrelenting focus in the markets, the winner is... Capital Dynamics!
#PlattsGEA: Our next Award of Excellence is for LNG. This awards the ability to adapt in this fast evolving market. And this year‚Äôs winner is...@bakerhughesco! Congratulations to all
#PlattsGEA: Up next we have the Award of Excellence: Downstream. This award is for successful alternative energy opportunities. And the 2019 winner is...@ValeroEnergy
#PlattsGEA: We now come to the Award of Excellence: Midstream.  The winner of this year‚Äôs award is...Enterprise Products Partners! Congratulations on a great win

#PlattsGEA: Our next award is for Upstream Transformation. This award recognises producers that are committed to providing affordability and energy efficiency. Our winner for this year is...@AdnocGroup! Well done to all

#PlattsGEA: Now onto our Awards of Excellence, first up we have Power. This award honours optimised performance and radical growth in a challenging environment . This year‚Äôs winner is @xcelenergy! A well deserved winner

#PlattsGEA: Our next award is a new category to the program - Corporate Award for Green Initiatives. This award recognizes a heavy energy consumer that is committed to energy efficiency. This year‚Äôs winner is...@Microsoft! Congratulations to all!

#PlattsGEA: Next up is the Corporate Social Responsibility Award for Diversified Program honours broader and more comprehensive programs with societal impact. This year‚Äôs winner is @ONGC_! Congratulations to all!

#PlattsGEA: The next set of awards will be for Corporate Social Responsibility, first up is the award for Targeted Program - for leadership and active participation in a specific time of need. And tonight‚Äôs winner is...Peru LNG! Well done to all
#PlattsGEA: We now recognize the Rising Star Award: Company and the award goes to...@ReNew_Power! Congratulations on a well deserved win!
Our next Rising Star individual award goes to Yoven Moorooven from @ENGIEgroup - an incredible win for such dedicated work on access to energy in Africa. #PlattsGEA

#PlattsGEA: We now come to the award for Rising Star: Individual. Judges elected to recognize two equally qualified winners, each with distinctive strengths, in this very competitive category. Our first award goes to Mai Al-Eisa from Kuwait Petroleum International. Well done!

#PlattsGEA: Up next, we‚Äôre presenting the award for Construction Project of the Year, this award is all about excellence in overall project execution and management. This year‚Äôs winner is...@SterlitePower! Well done on this incredible accomplishment

#PlattsGEA: Our next award is for Engineering Project of the Year. This award rewards excellency in overcoming specific engineering challenges. And the winner is...@DominionEnergy! Congratulations on a well deserved win

#PlattsGEA: Up next we‚Äôre presenting Commercial Technology of the Year. This award honours commercially applied innovation that creates efficiency and business advantage. And the winner is...@Limejump! Very well done to all

#PlattsGEA: For our first award of the evening we‚Äôre presenting Emerging Technology of the Year. This award recognises technology game changers in the industry. And the winner is...@NuScale_Power! Congratulations on this excellent win
We‚Äôd love to thank our entertainment this evening for such a fantastic performance! #PlattsGEA

Who loses in trade battle?  @KristenHays07 : Consumers do, because US companies pay the tariffs  #PlattsHOEF

. @SteelFitz : Last year was a party in US steel industry. Repercussions are being felt this year.  Half-full: US industry is going to be modernized.  Half-empty: US now has a lot of high-cost producers.  #PlattsHOEF

. @meghangordon : From China's perspective, they have every incentive to wait on a trade deal.  @KristenHays07 : Concern is that everything can change w/o warning in one tweet from president.   #PlattsHOEF

. @KristenHays07 : Market sentiment is frustration with the uncertainty re: trade. Companies trying to plan out supply chain. Tariffs on one component could have domino effect. Conventional wisdom is that China will just dig in and wait.   #PlattsHOEF
. @KristenHays07 : No projects have been postponed because of #tariffs, but have increased their contingency plans. Companies are planning for the long term, not the next year or so.  #PlattsHOEF

. @meghangordon : Cactus II pipeline planned #steel surcharge to deal with tariffs; that was pulled back.  @SteelFitz : Many applications for exemptions were based on steel quality, specifications.   #PlattsHOEF

. @SteelFitz : #Tariffs have not had a major impact on #steel available for pipelines. Many applications for exemptions were denied by US. #HRC prices have been a roller-coaster since tariffs went in place. Prices hit 10-year high & 3-year low in 18 months.   #PlattsHOEF #steel
. @KristenHays07 - Impact of #tariffs has not been dramatic for pricing in most cases, but has altered trade flows. Changing trade flows takes a lot of time & expense.   #PlattsHOEF
. @SteelFitz : Metals tariffs impacting all US trade partners; began in 2017 on #steel, #aluminum.   #PlattsHOE
. @meghangordon : Tariffs didn't affect US #crudeoil to China until September. YTD exports to China less than 6% of US exports. Less impact that trade conflict's impact on oil prices.   #PlattsHOEF

How have tariffs affect trade flows from the US?  @KristenHays07 : Tariffs on US #polyethylene key because majority of new US capacity is destined for Asia & China. Recently announced US tariffs more targeted at finished products. Many pushed back to after holidays.  #PlattsHOEF
Dispatches from the trade wars -- Tariff impacts on #metals, #petrochemicals and beyond  Panel: Matt Cook @meghangordon  @KristenHays07  @SteelFitz   #PlattsHOEF #globaltrade
Final panel updates for the day coming soon: Dispatches from the trade wars -- Tariff impacts on metals, petrochemicals and beyond  #PlattsHOEF #petrochemicals #metals

. @meghangordon - We keep hearing that new deal is coming this week. Some concerns that if 2020 volumes are raised, is that legal? Does that start another lawsuit? What happens with small #refinery waivers? Should there be a cap on #RINs price  #PlattsHOEF #ethanol #biofuels
. @meghangordon - Potential Trump deal with #crudeoil, #biofuel producers has been building for two years now. The politics have gotten even trickier for Trump.
Pedrick: When you produce #E15, you give away some octane when blended with CBOB, RBOB. #Refiners do not want to do this.   #PlattsHOEF #ethanol

Pedrick: Challenges are there for #E15. Different for drivers. Nozzle is different. May be an easy sell in Iowa, but different in Houston, New York. Price point is important given lower energy content.
Lavinsky: #E15 is very good for the #ethanol industry. It's like a slow-moving storm. It's going to hit that point where it's going to shoot up. Time for movement is now.  #PlattsHOEF

. @meghangordon : Refinery side has said that #biofuel producers keep asking for more, no matter what is agreed.  Pedrick: #biofuel produces point to difference in current volumes compared with promised volumes under original law.  #PlattsHOEF
RVO volumes have fallen from all-time highs, driven by policy shifts.  #PlattsHOEF #biofuels
Lavinsky: EPA's actions are the biggest factor in reducing #biofuel demand.   #PlattsHOEF
. @meghangordon : Waivers skyrocketing in comparison with previous administrations. It's a fundamental debate between refiners and biofuel producers.
EPA has the authority to modify #RFS mandates  Lavinsky: 2016 mandates reduced by EPA, but courts found reasons were improper.   #PlattsHOEF
